intro: Chimarrhis duckeana, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in spherical inflorescences. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Chimarrhis duckeana is an important species in Australian flora and is the national floral emblem of Australia.
